div.l: She was y fostrid in a Nonnerye
For Symkyn wold no wif as he seid
But she wel norishid were ⁊and a maid
To saue his estate of yemanry
And she was proude and pert as a pye
A ful feir sight was it upon hem two
On halidaies beforn̄ hir wold he go
With his tipet wound about his hede
And she cam aftir in a gite of rede
And Symkin had hosen̄ of the same
Ther durst no wight clepe hir but madame
Was none so hardy that went by þe wey
That with hir durst rage or pley
But if he wold be slayn̄ of Symkyn̄
With panade with knyf or with bodkyn̄
For ielous folk ben̄ ꝑperilous eủermo
Algate they wold her wyues wend so
And eke for she was sumdel smoterlich
She was as digne as watir in a diche
And as ful of hokir and of bismare
Hir thouȝt that a ladi shuld hir spare
What for hir kynrede and for hir nurtilry
That she had lerned in the Nonrye
A dougt̉er had they betuyx hem two
Of twenti yere without any mo
Sauyng a child that halue yere was of age
In cradil it lay and was a ꝓpropre page
This wench thicke and wel y grown̄ was
With camois nose and eyen as grey as glas
With buttokis brood and brestis round ⁊and hye
But right feir was hir here I nyl not lye
The parson̄ of the toun̄ for she was so feir͗e
In purpos was to make hir his heire
Both of his catelle and of his mesuage
And straunge he made it of hir mariage
His purpos was to bestow hir hye
Into sum wurthy blood of auncetry
For holichurch good must be dispendid
On holichurch blood that is discendid
Therfore he wil his holi blood honour͗e
Thaugh that he shuld holichurch deuour͗e
Gret socoủre hath this Milner out of dout
With whete and malt of al þe cuntre about
